Description: The session will provide an overview of current research focused on understanding the role of bacteria in cancer, including some discussions on how to evaluate the impact of microbes on the immune response, cancer risk, and response to treatment. The speakers will discuss approaches, new findings, and challenges in three different fields addressing the bacteria-cancer axis. The first talk will summarize epidemiological research on bacteria, immunity, and cancer risk; the second talk will highlight how gut microbes influence gut immunity; and the third talk will provide an overview of collaborative efforts across research and clinical teams to develop strategies to target the microbiome in cancer patients.
SearchResultBody: ED030. The Bacterial-Cancer Axis: What Does it Mean?
Title: The Bacterial-Cancer Axis: What Does it Mean?
